intro: Muellera amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian muellera, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible and often consumed by local wildlife. Muellera amazonica thrives in humid, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat.
